title: Selig's contract extension approved by owners
subtitle: Selig's contract extension approved by owners
body: PARADISE VALLEY, Ariz. -- A two-year contract extension for Commissioner Bud Selig was approved on Wednesday by Major League Baseball's executive council, setting up Thursday's confirmation vote by the full ownership.  Selig declined to comment about the matter on the first day of the two-day quarterly meetings of owners at the Sanctuary in Phoenix, stopping a reporter in mid-sentence.  "I'm not even going to let you ask the question," Selig, baseball's ninth Commissioner, said with a laugh about remaining on the job through the 2014 season. "We'll talk about it tomorrow." Barry M. Bloom a> is national reporter for MLB.com and writes an MLBlog, Boomskie on Baseball. Follow @boomskie on Twitter. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Barry M. Bloom
